projects_portfolio.name: Powered Proctoring System
projects_portfolio.description: Real-time cheating detection using YOLOv8, MediaPipe, and DeepSORT for academic exam monitoring.
projects_portfolio.detailed_description: End-to-end computer vision system that monitors students during exams and detects suspicious behaviors including phone usage, unusual head movements, and hand gestures. Features real-time alerting, customizable detection thresholds, and comprehensive reporting dashboard.

star_format.situation: University experiencing 15-20 cheating incidents per semester detected through manual monitoring, affecting academic integrity for 500+ students across 3 departments. Manual proctoring required 2 staff members per exam room, costing ₱200K annually in labor.
star_format.task: Design and implement an AI-powered proctoring system to automatically detect suspicious behaviors in real-time with 90%+ accuracy and <10% false positive rate, reducing manual monitoring workload by 50%+.
action: Conducted stakeholder interviews with exam coordinators to define suspicious behaviors taxonomy (7 behavior types identified)
Collected and annotated 5,000+ images covering diverse scenarios (lighting conditions, student demographics, seating positions)
Architected multi-model system: YOLOv8 for object detection (phones, papers), MediaPipe for pose estimation, DeepSORT for tracking
Implemented custom training pipeline with data augmentation (brightness, rotation, noise) achieving 93% validation accuracy
Optimized inference from 10 FPS to 30 FPS via INT8 quantization (44MB→11MB) and parallel preprocessing
Built Flask-based alerting system with configurable sensitivity and real-time dashboard for proctors
Conducted 100+ exam sessions for validation, iteratively reducing false positives from 40% to <5%
Presented findings to academic panel, secured ₱150K additional funding for deployment
result: Achieved 92% detection accuracy with <5% false positive rate in production
Reduced manual monitoring workload by 60% (from 40 hours/week to 16 hours/week)
Successfully deployed across 3 departments monitoring 500+ students over 100+ exam sessions
Saved ₱200K annually in manual proctoring costs
Published research paper, cited in 3 follow-up studies
99.2% system uptime during exam periods (only 1 outage in 6 months)
Improved exam cheating detection rate from 60% (manual) to 92% (AI-assisted)
Reduced false accusations by 75% compared to manual observation

key_features: Multi-model integration for comprehensive detection
Real-time inference at 30 FPS on standard hardware (RTX 3060)
Custom-trained models on 5,000+ annotated images
Alerting system with configurable sensitivity (3 levels: low, medium, high)
Analytics dashboard for proctors with historical data
Privacy-preserving design (local processing, no cloud storage of video)
Automated report generation with incident timestamps
projects_portfolio.impact: Enhanced academic integrity through AI-based monitoring. Deployed across 3 departments, monitoring 500+ students, achieving 92% accuracy with <5% false positives.

challenges_overcome.challenge: Slow inference speed (10 FPS) inadequate for real-time monitoring
challenges_overcome.solution: INT8 quantization + parallel preprocessing + optimized frame capture

challenges_overcome.challenge: 40% false positive rate causing student complaints
challenges_overcome.solution: Expanded dataset diversity (2K→5K images) + ensemble voting + adjusted confidence thresholds
Created training materials, conducted 12 workshops, established peer review process
challenges_overcome.result: Team proficient in 6 weeks, 75% reduction in annotation errors

challenges_overcome.solution: Implemented local processing, data anonymization, secure storage with encryption

technical_deep_dive.model_architecture: YOLOv8m (medium variant) fine-tuned on custom dataset

awards_recognition: Best Capstone Project 2024 - St. Paul University IT Department

projects_portfolio.name: Digital Twin RAG System
projects_portfolio.description: AI-driven interview assistant using RAG and vector embeddings for personalized career preparation.
projects_portfolio.detailed_description: Intelligent system that creates a digital representation of a candidate's profile and enables AI-powered interviews using Retrieval-Augmented Generation. Integrates with MCP servers for seamless knowledge retrieval and supports multi-turn conversational interviews.

star_format.situation: Job seekers struggle with interview preparation, receiving generic advice that doesn't leverage their specific experiences. Traditional resume reviews lack personalization and real-time practice scenarios.
star_format.task: Build an AI interview assistant that understands a candidate's unique profile and conducts realistic interview simulations with personalized feedback using Retrieval-Augmented Generation.
action: Designed RAG architecture using vector embeddings for semantic search of candidate profile
Implemented MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for extensible knowledge base integration
Built FastAPI backend with endpoints for profile management, embedding generation, and interview simulation
Developed Next.js 13 frontend with TypeScript, server components, and Tailwind CSS for responsive design
Integrated Upstash Vector database for efficient similarity search (sub-2s query latency)
Connected Groq API (Llama 3.1) for fast LLM inference with RAG-enhanced context
Implemented multi-turn conversation handling with context preservation
Added comprehensive interview scenarios: behavioral (STAR format), technical deep-dives, situational judgments
result: Achieved <2 second average response time for interview questions
High semantic relevance in retrieved context (95%+ relevance based on user testing)
Supports 3 interview types with 50+ question templates
Successfully deployed on Vercel with 99.5% uptime
Reduced interview prep time from hours of googling to 30-minute targeted sessions
Received positive feedback from 10 beta testers (4.5/5 rating)

key_features: Vector-based semantic search for profile information (1536-dim embeddings)
MCP server integration for extensible knowledge base
Next.js 13 frontend with responsive design (mobile-first)
RESTful API for profile management (CRUD operations)
Real-time interview simulation with streaming responses
Context-aware follow-up questions based on candidate's answers
Interview performance analytics and improvement suggestions
projects_portfolio.impact: Enabled personalized interview preparation using AI knowledge retrieval. Supports multiple interview scenarios and provides actionable feedback.

challenges_overcome.challenge: Learning MCP protocol within 1 week for project deadline
challenges_overcome.solution: Intensive 3-day documentation study + built POC in 2 days + iterated based on testing
challenges_overcome.result: Delivered functional MCP integration in 7 days

challenges_overcome.challenge: Optimizing embedding generation for large profiles (5000+ words)
challenges_overcome.solution: Chunking strategy (500-word segments with 50-word overlap) + batch processing
challenges_overcome.result: Reduced embedding time from 30s to 5s (6x improvement)

challenges_overcome.challenge: Ensuring context relevance in RAG retrieval
challenges_overcome.solution: Semantic reranking + hybrid search (vector + keyword) + threshold filtering (>0.7 similarity)
challenges_overcome.result: 95%+ context relevance based on user feedback

future_enhancements: Add voice interview mode with speech-to-text
Implement company-specific interview prep (parse job postings)
Add interview recording and playback for self-review
Integrate with LinkedIn for automatic profile import

Hyperparameter tuning with Optuna
Experiment tracking with W&B

key_features: Multi-threading for parallel image processing
Custom memory management for performance-critical code
Modern C++ practices (RAII, smart pointers, move semantics)

career_goals.short_term: Secure an AI/ML developer role focusing on computer vision, RAG systems, or intelligent applications. Open to junior roles with clear AI specialization path.

career_goals.honest_about_fit: I'm most valuable in roles leveraging my AI/ML expertise. For general programming roles, I'd need clear career progression toward AI specialization to maintain long-term engagement.

behavioral.question: Tell me about a time you overcame a technical challenge under pressure.
behavioral.answer_framework: During the Powered Proctoring project, our model had only 10 FPS performance which was inadequate for real-time monitoring. Under a tight 2-week deadline, I researched and implemented model quantization and optimized the inference pipeline, achieving 30 FPS. This taught me the importance of performance profiling and iterative optimization.

improved_star_format.situation: Two weeks before our academic presentation, our proctoring system ran at 10 FPS - too slow for real-time detection. The academic panel would only approve production deployment if we achieved 25+ FPS.
improved_star_format.task: As lead developer, I needed to optimize inference speed by 2.5x in 14 days without sacrificing accuracy.
improved_star_format.action: I profiled the code and found bottlenecks in model inference and frame processing. I implemented INT8 quantization (reducing model size from 44MB to 11MB), parallelized preprocessing in separate threads, and optimized frame capture with OpenCV. I validated each optimization with A/B tests to ensure accuracy remained above 90%.
improved_star_format.result: Achieved 30 FPS (3x improvement) while maintaining 92% accuracy. The academic panel approved deployment, and the system now monitors 500+ students across 3 departments. This taught me that systematic profiling beats guessing, and that performance optimization is a data-driven process.
improved_star_format.quantified_impact: 3x speed improvement, 0% accuracy loss, approved for production use

behavioral.question: Describe a project where you led a team through research and development.
behavioral.answer_framework: I led the Powered Proctoring project with 3 team members. I designed the architecture, established Git workflows, conducted weekly training sessions on YOLOv8, and mentored a junior developer. We successfully deployed across 3 departments with 92% accuracy. My leadership approach focuses on knowledge sharing and clear communication.

behavioral.question: Tell me about a time you failed and what you learned.
behavioral.answer_framework: In early model training, I had 40% false positives because I didn't account for diverse lighting conditions. I learned the importance of comprehensive data collection and augmentation. I rebuilt the dataset with varied scenarios, implemented augmentation techniques, and reduced false positives to <5%. This taught me to think holistically about edge cases.

improved_star_format.situation: After initial deployment of our proctoring system, we received complaints about 40% false positive rate - students were flagged incorrectly for cheating during legitimate activities like adjusting posture.
improved_star_format.task: I owned the mistake and committed to reducing false positives below 5% within one month while maintaining detection accuracy.
improved_star_format.action: I analyzed failure cases and discovered I hadn't collected training data across diverse lighting conditions and student behaviors. I expanded our dataset from 2,000 to 5,000 images covering varied scenarios (bright/dim lighting, different skin tones, various seating positions). I implemented data augmentation (brightness, rotation, noise) and retrained the model with adjusted confidence thresholds. I also added an ensemble voting system combining YOLOv8 and MediaPipe to reduce single-model errors.
improved_star_format.result: Reduced false positives from 40% to <5% over 4 weeks while maintaining 92% true positive rate. More importantly, I learned that diverse, representative training data is crucial for production ML systems. I now always plan for edge cases upfront and involve end-users in data collection.
improved_star_format.lesson_learned: Failure taught me humility and the importance of comprehensive testing. I now use confusion matrices, per-class analysis, and real-world validation before claiming 'production-ready'.
improved_star_format.growth_demonstrated: Took ownership, systematically debugged, implemented lasting solution, documented learnings for future projects

behavioral.question: Why are you applying for this entry-level role when you have AI research experience?

answer_framework.honest_answer: I understand this might seem like a step backward, but here's my thinking: First, I want to build strong software engineering fundamentals beyond just ML - things like production code quality, testing, CI/CD, and working in larger codebases. Second, I'm specifically drawn to [mention specific aspect from job posting]. Third, I'm early in my career and value learning from experienced engineers over having a fancy title. That said, I'm most motivated by roles where I can apply AI skills - can you share if there are AI projects in the pipeline?
key_points: Focus on engineering fundamentals, not just AI
Show genuine interest in specific aspects of THIS role
avoid: Don't overemphasize AI skills (reinforces overqualification concern)
Don't be vague - reference specific job posting details

behavioral.question: How do you handle ambiguity when developing AI solutions?
behavioral.answer_framework: I start with research and prototyping. For the proctoring system, initial requirements were vague about 'suspicious behavior.' I conducted stakeholder interviews, created a taxonomy of behaviors, built multiple prototypes, and used A/B testing to validate approaches. I believe in iterative development with continuous feedback.

technical.question: Explain how YOLOv8 detects and classifies objects.
technical.answer_framework: YOLOv8 uses a single-stage detector with a CSPDarknet backbone for feature extraction, PANet for feature fusion, and a decoupled head for classification and localization. It divides images into grids, predicts bounding boxes and class probabilities per grid cell, uses anchor-free detection, and applies NMS for final predictions. I've trained custom YOLOv8 models on 5,000+ images.

technical.question: How would you integrate MediaPipe with YOLOv8 for multimodal detection?
technical.answer_framework: I implemented this in the proctoring system. YOLOv8 detects objects (phones, papers) while MediaPipe tracks poses and hand landmarks. Both run in parallel threads, outputs are synchronized by frame timestamp, combined detections feed into a decision engine. This multimodal approach improved accuracy by 25% compared to single-model detection.

technical.question: Describe how RAG systems use vector databases for retrieval.
technical.answer_framework: RAG embeds documents into vector space using models like sentence-transformers, stores them in vector databases (I use Upstash Vector), then retrieves relevant chunks via semantic similarity search at query time. The retrieved context augments the LLM prompt. I implemented this in my Digital Twin system for interview preparation, achieving high relevance in responses.

technical.question: How do you optimize model inference speed?
technical.answer_framework: I use multiple techniques: model quantization (FP32 to INT8), batch processing, GPU acceleration, removing unnecessary layers, using TensorRT for NVIDIA GPUs, and profiling bottlenecks with tools like cProfile. In the proctoring system, I optimized from 10 FPS to 30 FPS through quantization and pipeline parallelization.

situational.question: If your model misclassifies a cheating instance, how would you debug and improve it?
situational.answer_framework: I follow a systematic approach: 1) Analyze the failure case and collect similar examples, 2) Check if it's a data problem (add more training examples), model problem (adjust architecture/hyperparameters), or threshold issue, 3) Use confusion matrix and per-class metrics to identify patterns, 4) Implement fixes and validate with A/B testing, 5) Monitor production metrics continuously.

situational.question: How would you design a scalable proctoring system for 1000+ students?
situational.answer_framework: I'd use: 1) Microservices architecture with load balancers, 2) Distributed inference with model serving frameworks like TorchServe, 3) Message queues (RabbitMQ) for asynchronous processing, 4) Cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP) with auto-scaling, 5) Caching strategies for common queries, 6) Database sharding for performance, 7) Monitoring and alerting with Prometheus/Grafana.

situational.question: How would you approach a project with unclear requirements?
situational.answer_framework: I'd: 1) Schedule discovery sessions with stakeholders to understand goals, 2) Create user stories and acceptance criteria, 3) Build a minimal prototype for feedback, 4) Use agile methodology with 2-week sprints, 5) Maintain regular communication and demos, 6) Document decisions and assumptions, 7) Stay flexible and iterate based on feedback.

research_areas: AI ethics in surveillance and privacy
Cloud deployment optimization for ML models
preparation_questions: What excites you about our AI research?
How do your projects align with our mission?
What unique perspective do you bring to our team?
Where do you see AI heading in the next 5 years?

weakness_mitigation.progress: Deployed Digital Twin RAG system on Vercel, containerized proctoring system with Docker

weakness_mitigation.weakness: Early in career with limited industry experience
weakness_mitigation.mitigation: Compensating with strong academic research background, hands-on projects with real-world impact, and continuous learning. Open to mentorship and eager to learn from experienced engineers.
weakness_mitigation.progress: Led production deployment affecting 500+ users, published research paper, active in open-source community
weakness_mitigation.strength: Fresh perspective, up-to-date with latest AI technologies, hungry to prove myself

weakness_mitigation.weakness: Limited experience with large-scale distributed systems
weakness_mitigation.mitigation: Studying distributed systems architecture, microservices patterns, and cloud scalability best practices. Actively learning Kubernetes and container orchestration.
weakness_mitigation.progress: Implemented basic microservices architecture in recent projects, studying system design patterns

weakness_mitigation.weakness: May appear overqualified for entry-level roles (interview feedback)
weakness_mitigation.mitigation: Emphasizing genuine interest in learning fundamentals, building strong engineering foundation, and contributing to team success. Willing to start in junior roles with clear AI specialization path.
weakness_mitigation.approach: Positioning AI skills as value-add, not replacement for core engineering work. Showing enthusiasm for mentorship and growth.
weakness_mitigation.realistic_fit: Best suited for 'Junior AI Engineer' roles, not 'Generic Programmer' positions

key_talking_points: 92% detection accuracy in production computer vision system serving 500+ students
Led team of 3 through complete ML development lifecycle - architecture to deployment
Optimized model inference 3x (10 FPS → 30 FPS) through quantization and pipeline optimization
Built end-to-end AI systems from research to production deployment
Strong foundation in both computer vision (YOLOv8, MediaPipe) and NLP/RAG systems
Published research and presented to academic panels - strong technical communication
Reduced false positives by 70% through systematic debugging and ensemble methods
Experience with modern ML stack: YOLOv8, TensorFlow, RAG, vector databases, FastAPI
Proactively addressing skill gaps (C++) with dedicated learning plan and portfolio building
Open to junior roles with AI specialization path - prioritize learning over maximum salary

interview_red_flags_to_address.how_to_address: I understand my AI experience might seem advanced, but I'm genuinely excited about building strong software engineering fundamentals. I see this as an opportunity to learn from experienced engineers while contributing my AI skills where valuable. I'm looking for a long-term growth path, not just a stepping stone.
interview_red_flags_to_address.key_message: AI skills are bonus, not replacement for core engineering work

interview_red_flags_to_address.red_flag: C++ skills gap for C++ roles
interview_red_flags_to_address.how_to_address: You're right that my C++ experience is limited compared to Python. I'm actively building 3 C++ projects and dedicating 10 hours/week to strengthen this. I can show you my progress on GitHub. For this role, I'm confident I can ramp up quickly with mentorship. Would you be open to a small coding test to assess my C++ fundamentals?
interview_red_flags_to_address.key_message: Honest about gap + concrete action plan + willingness to prove competency

interview_red_flags_to_address.how_to_address: I've done more research and understand that ₱800K-1M is more appropriate for senior roles. For this position, I'm flexible and prioritize learning opportunities and AI project work over maximum salary. What's the budget range for this role, and is there room for growth as I prove my value?

interview_red_flags_to_address.red_flag: Flight risk - will leave for AI role
interview_red_flags_to_address.how_to_address: I appreciate the concern. I'm specifically targeting roles with AI components or clear paths to AI work. If this role involves [specific AI aspects from job posting], that aligns perfectly with my goals. Can you share more about AI projects in the pipeline and opportunities for specialization?
interview_red_flags_to_address.key_message: Seeking alignment, not just any job

ideal_fits: Junior AI/ML Engineer - leverages my computer vision skills while building engineering fundamentals
Computer Vision Developer - directly applies my YOLOv8/MediaPipe expertise
AI Research Engineer - combines academic background with production development
Software Engineer (AI Team) - general engineering with AI specialization
ML Platform Engineer - if role involves model deployment pipelines
moderate_fits: Full-Stack Developer with AI projects - can contribute backend/frontend, add AI value
Junior Software Engineer (with AI roadmap) - willing to start general if clear path to AI work
Data Engineer - relevant for ML pipelines, but less aligned with CV/NLP interests
poor_fits: Entry-level Programmer (no AI component) - risk of boredom and flight within 6-12 months
Senior C++ Developer - C++ skills gap too large currently
Pure Frontend Developer - limited AI application opportunities
Maintenance Engineer for legacy systems - misaligned with growth trajectory

must_haves: Opportunities to work with AI/ML technologies (70%+ of work)
Learning environment with mentorship from experienced engineers
Modern tech stack (Python, cloud platforms, ML frameworks)
Clear career progression path toward AI specialization
deal_breakers: No AI/ML work for 1+ years (will feel underutilized)
Toxic team culture or lack of mentorship
Outdated tech stack with no modernization plan
Role significantly below skill level with no growth path

will_stay_long_term_if: Role involves meaningful AI/ML work aligned with my skills
Team values innovation and technical excellence
flight_risk_indicators: Generic programming role with no AI work (high risk within 6 months)
Feeling overqualified with no challenge (medium risk within 12 months)
Better AI opportunity elsewhere (depends on company investment in me)
retention_honesty.commitment_approach: I want to find a role where I can grow for 2-3+ years, not just 'any job'. I'm willing to start junior if there's a clear path to AI specialization. I value loyalty and impact over title-hopping.

when_to_be_honest: If C++ role requires production C++ experience - admit gap and show learning plan
If salary expectations are misaligned - negotiate realistically
If role seems too junior - probe for AI growth opportunities
If asked about long-term plans - share AI career vision authentically
how_to_frame_honestly: C++ Gap: 'I'm currently basic in C++, but here's my 3-month plan to reach production level. Would you be open to assessing my progress with a coding test?'
Overqualification: 'I understand the concern. I'm specifically seeking roles with [AI component] to build engineering fundamentals while applying my strengths.'
Salary: 'I've adjusted my expectations based on market research. For this role, I'm targeting ₱[realistic range] with growth as I prove value.'
Career Goals: 'Long-term, I aim to specialize in AI systems. Does this role offer opportunities to work on AI projects or transition to AI team?'

work_preferences.team_size: Prefer small to medium teams (5-20 people)
work_preferences.project_preference: Hands-on technical work with measurable impact

personal_attributes.work_ethic: Consistently delivers high-quality work, meets deadlines, proactive communicator

hobbies_interests: Building side projects with emerging AI technologies
Reading AI research papers and blogs
